sentence.Network_en: We strolled past tinkling fountains and perfumed gardens.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们漫步经过泉水叮咚的喷泉和芬芳四溢的花园。

sentence.Network_en: The fountains in the park play on Sundays.
sentence.Network_cn: 公园里的喷泉星期天才喷水.

entry.def: A fountain is an ornamental feature in a pool or lake which consists of a long narrow stream of water that is forced up into the air by a pump.
A fountain of a liquid is an amount of it which is sent up into the air and falls back.

example.ex: The volcano spewed a fountain of molten rock 650 feet in the air.
example.tran: 这座火山喷射出的岩浆高达650英尺。

entry.def: If you describe a person or thing as a fountain of something, you mean they are an important source of it and supply a lot of it.

example.ex: You are a fountain of ideas.

Sentence.sentence: The curtains were never drawn, even at night, so guests got a view of the lake and fountains outside which were lit up at night – a very attractive sight.
